definitions.definition: Of, or relating to microscopes or microscopy; microscopal
definitions.example: We supply all microscopic stains and other materials.

definitions.definition: So small that it can only be seen using a microscope.
definitions.example: The water was full of microscopic organisms.
Compared to the galaxy, we are microscopic in scale.

definitions.definition: Carried out with great attention to detail.
definitions.example: The police carried out a microscopic search of the crime scene.

definitions.definition: Able to see extremely minute objects.
definitions.example: Why has not man a microscopic eye? — Alexander Pope.
